description: Students continue learning Spanish in an intercultural context.  The course continues to examine
the Spanish-speaking world through exploration of topics, for example: cities and urban life;
housing; and the historical roots of culinary traditions and food production.  In-class speaking,
listening, reading, and writing activities are complemented by attendance at two required culture
tables.  Offered each semester and Interim. Does not count toward Spanish major. Prerequisite:
fullname: Introduction to Spanish Language and the Spanish-Speaking World II
